sentence.text: That ` damned morality " which disturbed Lord Melbourne did not result from religious enthusiasm only .
` The only thing which disturbs me is if you brought me down here on false pretenses .
It disturbed him that she had n't broken the news by saying she was pregnant .
It did not disturb him that he had been under observation ; he was not accustomed to deprecate what he was , or to undervalue it .
` There were plenty of verbals intended to frighten the life out of someone , but it disturbs me that Jones is talking proudly about hurting players .
It might also have disturbed them to know that in such circumstances what is still a fairly new and effective lifeline for them would have been ruled out -- insurance .
And it disturbs you to realise that I did not come after you for the reasons you thought , does n't it ? "
So why did it disturb him with Deana ?
They do not want to disturb their child by commenting on how good he or she is in case the child starts to demand attention again .
Their findings disturbed the High Loremaster sufficiently for him to take them to the Phoenix King .
This appeal presaged two years of uncomfortable relations , which were to disturb the ILP without adding much to the strength of Trotskyism .
Something about it disturbed him -- not the obvious facts of its shock and tragedy -- but some discordant element , something that did n't ring true .
Secondly , he was disturbed by the fact that spiritual truths did n't stir his emotions or grip his imagination as much as he felt they should .
He was intrigued and a little disturbed by George 's attitude .
Perhaps they were disturbed by alarming reports from France , where the noble philosophical aims of Liberty , Equality and Fraternity were beginning to be taken a little too far .

By January 1946 de Gaulle was also disturbed by the growing influence of the main political parties , following the October elections of a Constituent Assembly , which was to devise a new constitution .
Jehan doubted if Mei Ling would be disturbed by her son 's descent into the water , but he thought it well to have attempted to do something , however belated .
The sound seemed to disturb Tal .
John was surprised and disturbed by the effect of seeing her again .
` I dare anything to help Berenice , " he said , not in the least disturbed by her rage .
